answers.answer: Hi there. The various causes for numbness first finger right hand could be trauma to the respective nerve branch of median or radial nerve depending on the palmar aspect or the dorsal aspect being affected.  Investigate for vitamin B12 and folate deficiencies, hypothyroidism, autoimmune disorders like rheumatoid arthritis, compression radiculopathy due to cervical spine intervertebral disc degeneration, prolapsed, spondylosis etc, nerve entrapments as in carpal tunnel syndrome, and metabolic conditions like diabetes mellitus. Consult a neurologist to investigate these causes using blood tests, imaging studies, nerve conduction studies etc. therapy would be according to the cause. Take care.

question: a patient sometimes felt a little numb on the right hand first finger. what is the most likely reason?
title: first finger sometimes feel numb
